elements.2211.03019_8f8d460b03fc89166cd4d2ba47c6b: Learning to localize the sound source in videos without explicit annotations is a novel area of audio-visual research
elements.2211.03019_35338b380b8465eb6e49eea14cc5a: Existing work in this area focuses on creating attention maps to capture the correlation between the two modalities to localize the source of the sound
elements.2211.03019_c3155f348ebe64d38b606bd113105: In a video, oftentimes, the objects exhibiting movement are the ones generating the sound
elements.2211.03019_32e47a27e6e7186b8fac6f865c688: In this work, we capture this characteristic by modeling the optical flow in a video as a prior to better aid in localizing the sound source
elements.2211.03019_367d492016fab5897e6df4abde62e: We further demonstrate that the addition of flow-based attention substantially improves visual sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_e98bac7c6a8f9fda5b8ae06595636: Finally, we benchmark our method on standard sound source localization datasets and achieve state-of-the-art performance on the Soundnet Flickr and VGG Sound Source datasets
elements.2211.03019_dc2d0e4ea9b8f2b8638556c202247: In recent years, the field of audio-visual understanding has become a very active area of research
elements.2211.03019_1871c9843e68c912beba36696b717: This can be attributed to the large amount of video data being produced as part of user-generated content on social media and other platforms
elements.2211.03019_782cb26201af8e9c4eb0a0b15db7f: Recent methods in audio-visual understanding have leveraged popular deep learning techniques to solve challenging problems such as action recognition
elements.2211.03019_be5d250a8d1d0b474b3f89ee4cb41: Given a video, one such task in audio-visual understanding is to locate the object in the visual space that is generating the prominent audio content
elements.2211.03019_cd42c1df4058568a8eca32a98fa58: When observing a natural scene, it is often trivial for a human to localize the region/object from which the sound originates
elements.2211.03019_485c81a658277158f43cfc813b2bb: One of the main reasons for this is the binaural nature of the human hearing sense
elements.2211.03019_3898a6f0b556268548f5d8c40596f: However, the majority of audio-visual data in digital media is monaural, which complicates audio localization tasks
elements.2211.03019_b6da1385b6f45a3aae8be7231dfc0: Furthermore, naturally occurring videos do not have explicit annotations of the location of the source of the audio in the image
elements.2211.03019_7f95cc65e9188aeacc171bd2e3aa9: This makes the task of training deep neural networks to understand audio-visual associations for localization a challenging task.
elements.2211.03019_38fe0ef3711cf2d28ce0f94e89f88: Owing to the success of self-supervised learning (SSL) in vision
elements.2211.03019_85dc3157f091527e26ebb03268c82: , recent methods in sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_01ad839ef8497d3387a96405fa052: have adopted SSL based methods to overcome the need for annotations
elements.2211.03019_042d37e6ff47aa12249ea7a78ae6e: , finds the cosine similarity between the audio and visual representations extracted convolutionally at different spatial locations in the images
elements.2211.03019_a497c3773758d00f1bcd120380780: They rely on self-supervised training by creating positive and negative associations from these predicted similarity matrices
elements.2211.03019_8ac6775f1bc1d0835afd3be0413bf: This bootstrapping approach has been shown to improve sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_e00122c3e4cbfaab38f64201205c9: Following this research finding, the majority of recent approaches in visual sound source localization have focused on creating robust optimization objectives for better audio-visual associations
elements.2211.03019_0895642d104b1fc78cc0830b982c2: However, one interesting aspect of the problem that has received relatively little attention is the creation of
elements.2211.03019_b6f9ba56557c79598025102a97a34: to improve the association of the audio to the correct
elements.2211.03019_8bb924eeee1d706109dfb51ee1777: sounding object" (or the object producing the sound)
elements.2211.03019_d4a665234f67b9a255c66bb011696: Priors can be viewed as potential regions in the image from where the sound may originate
elements.2211.03019_bc69cabeca33557f3ceb8bacf08ca: We can draw parallels to work in two-stage object detection methods, in which region proposal networks are used to identify regions in the image space that could potentially be objects
elements.2211.03019_b1bd66df5ac75ffa1acf739cb991c: However, generating potential candidate regions for sound source localization is more challenging because the generated priors should be relevant from a multi-modal perspective
elements.2211.03019_548e9dd5541371b76c9bbbc15f712: In order to generate these informative priors for where sounds possibly originate from, we leverage optical flow
elements.2211.03019_ce45f7a4153518fe9af15992b4879: The intuition behind using optical flow to create an enhanced prior is the fact that optical flow can model patterns of apparent motion of objects
elements.2211.03019_1de1e07f271f4bdb1e5ab91445114: This is important as most often, an object moving in a video tends to be the sound source
elements.2211.03019_84d8c4ce197436906c63a1170e193: Enforcing a constraint to prioritize the objects that tend to be in relative motion might lend itself to creating better sound source localizations
elements.2211.03019_2c4d29207e31eba72b0e935d71255: This paper proposes an optical flow-based localization network that can create informative priors for performing superior sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_9c176cf5ea1b11c36508a3498c9e6: The contributions in this paper are as follows:
elements.2211.03019_eff9d721e8fc11ccb32227fe85a89: We explore the need for creating informative priors for visual sound source localization, which is a complementary research direction to prior methods.
elements.2211.03019_e6acb9f4a791f99089db6a634ae5e: We propose the use of optical flow as an additional source of information to create informative priors.
elements.2211.03019_6b2bb7d620c7c89f9f29eeb798e48: We design an optical flow-based localization network that uses cross-attention to form stronger audio-visual associations for visual sound source localization.
elements.2211.03019_209a2836df12ad6d3ca12a488011c: We run extensive experiments on two benchmark datasets: VGG Sound and Flickr SoundNet and demonstrate the effectiveness of our method
elements.2211.03019_b325d7e5d7b9783989348f033f75a: Our method consistently achieves superior results over the state-of-the-art
elements.2211.03019_07b76078a6d6139b4718bdfad450f: We perform rigorous ablation studies and provide quantitative and qualitative results, showing the superiority of our novel localization network.
elements.2211.03019_e56e8fa114f92aa7a7270812f7961: Generating robust multi-modal representations through joint audio-visual learning is an active area of research that has found application in multiple audio-visual tasks
elements.2211.03019_f5ae848a4344b5ff2513915e82f2e: Initial works in the area of joint audio-visual learning focus on probabilistic approaches
elements.2211.03019_753b39c7731e094db32977fa7edac: , the audio-visual signals were modeled as samples from a multivariate Gaussian process, and audio-visual synchrony was defined as the mutual information between the modalities.
elements.2211.03019_71f5c9a92c08154aa49faf2f212ca: focused on first learning a lower-dimensional subspace that maximized mutual information between the two modalities
elements.2211.03019_6ebfdcb293c6ae2a551c0321c73bc: Furthermore, they explored the relationship between these audio-visual signals using non-parametric density estimators.
elements.2211.03019_4dbc8bc427f399cf2b56a1415cee4: proposed a spatio-temporal segmentation mechanism that relies on the velocity and acceleration of moving objects as visual features and used canonical correlation analysis to associate the audio with relevant visual features
elements.2211.03019_9c15faf268ef7489f10386cd5b4bb: In recent years, deep learning-based methods have been used to explore the creation of better bimodal representations
elements.2211.03019_f9b74dc7a162e74f11357cd6c501b: They mostly employ two-stream networks to encode each modality individually and employ a contrastive loss-based supervision to align the two representations
elements.2211.03019_170e5530d15ecaf2e5c2a247eb23d: used source separation to localize audio via motion trajectory-based fusion and synchronization
elements.2211.03019_e7bb78390ba1934acdc6c743db12b: addressed the problem of separating multiple sound sources from unconstrained videos by creating coarse to fine-grained alignment of audio-visual representations
elements.2211.03019_e3a07d4302a59a43de1991a7ee0ee: uses class attention maps to help generate saliency maps that are used for better sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_2a435c6c281508011b96866407ee3: More recently, methods have focused on creating objective functions specific to sound localization.
elements.2211.03019_0ab618af9da5fcc540f7bca3a0a17: introduced the concept of tri-map, which incorporates background mining techniques into the self-supervised learning setting
elements.2211.03019_0f457d123f09c4883846a5a68c5eb: The tri-map contains an area of positive correlation, no correlation (background), and an ignore zone to avoid uncertain areas in the visual space.
elements.2211.03019_dd664d3c3db924e3be247ae75b416: introduced a negative-free method for sound-localization by mining explicit positives
elements.2211.03019_7b64debb187d83d5a145ea5ceef11: Further, this method uses a predictive coding technique to create better a feature alignment between the audio and visual modalities
elements.2211.03019_3c27ae9c3c3a6e84077efe2571951: These recent methods mainly focus on creating stronger optimization objectives for visual sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_0b8c62f5bc340a88247aca32878b6: A complementary direction in the research landscape is to explore creating more informative priors for audio-visual association
elements.2211.03019_bc0dcc79b87533093f312832d29ea: In this paper, we explore one such idea, which leverages optical flow
elements.2211.03019_9c649f59b9b5199114c1d1abaab08: have explored the use of optical flow in the context of certain audio-visual tasks, like retrieval
elements.2211.03019_ca18f7a7a590133b18b06ddad596e: In this work, we explore the use of optical flow as an informative prior for visual sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_bd5787e847622ab7a515dda6c73a6: Optical flow provides a means to estimate pixel-wise motion between consecutive frames
elements.2211.03019_0b94e444bb090378be1f24d68798e: presented optical flow prediction as an energy minimization problem with several objective terms utilizing continuous optimization
elements.2211.03019_fbd2ca148b2cb20b71b614a8d1964: Optical flow maps can be broadly divided into two types: Sparse and Dense
elements.2211.03019_87c5e0c82d708bd72bcc49ee83b2b: Sparse optical flow represents the motion of salient features in a frame, whereas Dense optical flow represents the motion flow vectors for the whole frame
elements.2211.03019_e28866530da335b73b01808e5e35d: Earlier methods for sparse optical flow estimation include the Lucas-Kanade algorithm
elements.2211.03019_9a5cc8d0b32554faba5f7cec7eb05: , which utilizes brightness constancy equations to optimize a least squares approximation under the assumption that flow remains locally smooth and the relative displacement of neighboring pixels is constant
elements.2211.03019_8dcaade2988db16ff4366bfef126e: proposed a dense optical flow estimation technique where quadratic polynomials were utilized to approximate pixel neighborhood for two frames, and these polynomials were then used to compute global displacement
elements.2211.03019_b93675cb4758f3ff4b2138ee2327c: proposed the first CNN-based approach towards estimating optical flow maps where they computed static cross-correlation between intermediate convolutional feature maps for two consecutive frames and up-scale them to extract optical flow maps.
elements.2211.03019_c4b5cb16a5fffc3e450bdbf2081fd: In this section, we will first present the formulation of the sound source localization problem under a supervised setting
elements.2211.03019_3d8705e18ab0f375ba14708188db3: Following this, we will describe the current self-supervised approach, motivate the need for better localization proposals for sound source localization, and subsequently elaborate on the design and implementation of our novel optical flow-based sound source localization network.

elements.2211.03019_9af53f440fe825fd91ce56fa8e8dc: prior, it may be useful for self-supervised sound localization as the most salient objects in a frame are often the ones emitting the sound

elements.2211.03019_d5f6da405c6c545c51212b6f42cca: in the initial iterations, which, when used for self-supervised training as mentioned in Eq

elements.2211.03019_cbb9569654f8907b7c789a5bb4940: to improve audio-visual associations, subsequently improving self-supervised learning.
elements.2211.03019_c81a40d7ac5cca601e7a8ad8d8619: Having motivated the need for some meaningful priors that enable better audio-visual associations, we approach the problem from an object detection viewpoint
elements.2211.03019_cb8852aba37983bd13507395783d3: In earlier object detection methods such as R-CNN
elements.2211.03019_8e2122958ae112e6d1b4da7f76560: , a selective search was used as a method to generate region proposals
elements.2211.03019_23d7b10e146f2f0d991a11c16d780: Selective search provided a set of probable locations where an object of interest may be present
elements.2211.03019_d653f5455cd97f97a9ee93e3b763a: An alternative to selective search-based approaches is a two-stage approach like in
elements.2211.03019_352bc09a1cf1eec49d69e59cf2c07: Most of these region proposal networks have auxiliary training objectives in order to produce regions containing potential objects
elements.2211.03019_30f8e49ed5e9da9382ec0823b98f5: Using these objectives to generate potential regions of interest in a self-supervised setting becomes challenging
elements.2211.03019_336362a02cdbb9d7b24fd6c8d719f: Furthermore, generating candidate regions using selective search or regular region proposal networks, only based on visual modality, might not be well suited for enforcing priors for a cross-modal task such as visual sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_a4d7d99b9063aafecef9c28149d0a: As a better alternative, we use optical flow to generate informative localization proposals
elements.2211.03019_f9ad342934f61907ef8d8dd65d0a3: Optical flow using frames of a video can efficiently capture the objects that are moving
elements.2211.03019_b406192ad77ba02d26e6de9abf6e5: Most often, these objects are the source of the sound
elements.2211.03019_af495dbbb38b08b737344d93d47ad: Capturing optical flow in the pixel space can often be a good prior to improve audio-visual association
elements.2211.03019_611c2f6548a5dfb246691bebfdef2: Furthermore, since the optical flow tends to focus on the relative motion of objects rather than the salient objects, it can complement the priors of the pre-trained vision model, which tends to focus on the latter
elements.2211.03019_8269ff7b02d850c021518cb2af69b: We design a network as shown in Figure
elements.2211.03019_fe48a709fe4e4def2863cae2bab83: , which takes in optical flow computed between two adjacent video frames and generates regions in the feature map
elements.2211.03019_092ae08ab9486457cd88d02555b1e: that act as priors to create better audio-visual associations
elements.2211.03019_bfb870155016ad1a49cbe959d6bd8: The localization network is comprised of a cross-attention between the feature representation extracted from image and flow modalities
elements.2211.03019_0400dc6c4a2e8e3f1c32bf517103b: , we project these feature representations using separate projection layers to create two tensors
elements.2211.03019_e35e5b8c4a2642fa83e0336075b24: is computed as an outer product of the tensors
elements.2211.03019_2709124e48e8e0a1adabf7c699d56: The softmax function is applied to the final dimension to normalize the attention matrix
elements.2211.03019_8e3525be6d3529a017983cc4d0371: The goal is to compute the attention to be applied to each spacial location, thus yielding a cross attention matrix of size
elements.2211.03019_643e2ee8d5cd379dd2930afe1d1ee: We compute another tensor from the visual modality
elements.2211.03019_d0c7a6fe2d6f7b7ffa51bdda07bf4: dimensional representation which we multiply to the corresponding
elements.2211.03019_5b58e28156fecc828fa6f45221eeb: is projected back to produce the final cross-attended proposal prior
elements.2211.03019_20b446501827c436539c8cab6301d: In order to impose this prior for performing the audio-visual association, we add
elements.2211.03019_d9999c2002934d2cec65a9585177c: The enhanced audio-visual association can be written as:
elements.2211.03019_250cb67c9597976b94537ef3aa878: Once the enhanced audio-visual association is obtained, we use Eq
elements.2211.03019_29ffec326c45d88e8c4175c9a2a54: to compute the positive and negative responses
elements.2211.03019_f8cd396d3081806d67e19570344a1: We train the entire network (feature extractors and localization network) end-to-end using the optimization objective mentioned in Eq
elements.2211.03019_8f8b552e4065c9f40d65ec0c3d617: For training and evaluating our proposed model, we follow prior work in this area and use two large-scale audio-visual datasets:
elements.2211.03019_7d438524be7d71acf54025253eff5: is a collection of over 2 million unconstrained videos collected from the Flickr platform
elements.2211.03019_849ac1f4bcadcd491a65a20cad218: To directly compare against prior works, we construct two subsets of 10k and 144k videos that are preprocessed into extracted image-audio pairs, described further in Section
elements.2211.03019_c7ecb4261422c381d5eeaedacfcf6: The Flickr SoundNet evaluation dataset consists of 250 image-audio pairs with labeled bounding boxes localized on the sound source in the image, manually annotated by
elements.2211.03019_58fd4badf37bdc77c7385edb2bdf6: is a dataset of 200k video clips spread across 309 sound categories
elements.2211.03019_71f209bf0af4cd743f175f72bdf4c: Similar to Flickr SoundNet, we construct subsets of 10k and 144k image-audio pairs to train our proposed model
elements.2211.03019_de637ca57383d3d9a702e3914ce88: For evaluation, we utilize the VGG Sound Source
elements.2211.03019_cb82bd5fc8727104599150fc083e0: dataset, which contains 5000 annotated image-audio pairs that span 220 sound categories
elements.2211.03019_b90bf05802d36402222b0cd35a82a: Compared to the Flickr SoundNet test set, which has about 50 sound categories, VGG Sound Source has significantly more sounding categories, making it a more challenging scenario for sound localization.
elements.2211.03019_0332bfd0040503a2731debd3c0a5b: For proper comparisons against prior works, we use two metrics to quantify audio localization performance: Consensus Intersection Over Union (cIoU) and Area Under Curve of cIoU scores (AUC)
elements.2211.03019_575927fd6212525acb4be772e581a: . cIoU quantifies localization performance by measuring the intersection over union of a ground-truth annotation and a localization map, where the ground-truth is an aggregation of multiple annotations, providing a single consensus
elements.2211.03019_8de5b7f0c5da8ed574124b7f778cd: AUC is calculated by the area under the curve of cIoU created from thresholds varying from 0 to 1
elements.2211.03019_5b63f5298790b9f940ea3d8308ae3: In our experiments, we show results for cIoU at a threshold of 0.5, denoted by
elements.2211.03019_a49165f948b8be50dffccbc9f5df1: In this paper, sound source localization is defined as localizing an excerpt of audio to its origin location in an image frame, both extracted from its respective video clip
elements.2211.03019_8354b2ba983ddab88db37416e6a50: For both Flickr SoundNet and VGG Sound, we extract the middle frame of a video along with 3 seconds of audio centered around the middle frame and a calculated dense optical flow field to construct an image-flow-audio pair
elements.2211.03019_40578b9b95129bafdb6328ea97d7c: For the image frames, we resize images to
elements.2211.03019_2bd859a408efa61180dad84140a55: and perform random cropping and horizontal flipping data augmentations
elements.2211.03019_f3cc4fb02b78b7d7490d9848c5a03: To calculate an optical flow field corresponding to the middle frame, we take the middle frame and subsequent frame of a video
elements.2211.03019_2034a35f772a1e652aa8825635be6: respectively, and use the Gunnar Farneback
elements.2211.03019_8490bb8136b6ad5ec57e9a1ae2a80: algorithm to generate a 2-channel flow field corresponding to horizontal and vertical flow vectors denoting movement magnitude
elements.2211.03019_99e4953e5df35da194273dea5cd85: We similarly perform random cropping and horizontal flipping of the flow fields, which are performed consistently with image augmentations
elements.2211.03019_ed7e196e4dce983bd115a544bee76: For audio, we sample 3 seconds of the video at 16kHz and construct a log-scaled spectrogram using a bin size of 256, FFT window of 512 samples, and stride of 274 samples, resulting in a shape of
elements.2211.03019_016a1196106cf33b70368c5a9077c: , we use ResNet18 backbones as the visual and audio feature extractors
elements.2211.03019_87923ddffd371f024a4d57d812613: Similarly, we use ResNet18 as the optical flow feature extractor
elements.2211.03019_1ec35a3bd61d7555f6d12d2fb8957: We pretrain the visual and flow feature extractors on ImageNet and leave the audio network randomly initialized
elements.2211.03019_c947be4a94a1bfdfbb3cf6a8faa51: During training, we keep the visual feature extractor parameters frozen
elements.2211.03019_539747dcfa330ea2ae76f4b523b84: For all experiments, we train the model using the Adam optimizer with a learning rate of

elements.2211.03019_edeb1ebb3222bd840c3db827f3b86: In this section, we compare our method against prior works

elements.2211.03019_125ad91e5cf62d3ab7db08ad0a395: on standardized experiments for self-supervised visual sound source localization

elements.2211.03019_0ca802164e523075b8c723736b95b: Further, we investigate the robustness of our method by evaluating it across the VGG Sound and Flickr SoundNet datasets
elements.2211.03019_36e38bc6bfe487878032dccc04003: Specifically, we train our model with 144k VGG Sound samples and test on the Flickr SoundNet test set
elements.2211.03019_092c83f62aa33640720294a3639ee: , we significantly outperform all methods, as shown in Table
elements.2211.03019_1cef784e38aa8f252b10b81cd9be8: , which shows our model is capable of generalizing well across datasets
elements.2211.03019_9f7fdf9e0bf05e2cab85093773000: We further investigate our method's robustness by testing on sound categories that are
elements.2211.03019_8c54ececa9479599aa17b592c6ffa: from what is seen during training
elements.2211.03019_be34323ae454cdc0d3fda892cf516: , we sample 110 sound categories from VGG Sound for training and test on the same 110 categories (heard) used during training and 110 other disjoint (unheard) sound categories
elements.2211.03019_f02990a652738730be74b6b9e3af2: on both heard and unheard testing subsets
elements.2211.03019_23c6bb8f51d1dbd7c7f9777be3399: In addition, we highlight that the performance of the unheard subset slightly outperforms the heard subset, showing our model performs well against unheard sound categories
elements.2211.03019_2557872b1765fbb372bae14f9228d: Utilizing a self-supervised loss formulation similar to
elements.2211.03019_4c0cb8d8daa96a15eeb0aef2b2048: , we see that our method significantly outperforms it on both testing datasets across all training setups and experiments
elements.2211.03019_0f18d9a48f8e47e797f49ca0fd8df: We highlight that these improvements are obtained from incorporating a more informative prior, based on optical flow, into the sound localization objective
elements.2211.03019_90bac96b05bafb80179bbc8b7989b: , we further investigate the direct influence of incorporating optical flow along with our other design choices.
elements.2211.03019_4e32e515abf0177fb4a0296c60341: , we visualize and compare sound localizations of LVS
elements.2211.03019_50446c22350d19a7a11ebcc0a4e52: and our method on the Flickr SoundNet and VGG Sound Source test sets
elements.2211.03019_3653d7540153d2c99e7ff59c5c71d: As shown, our method can accurately localize various types of sound sources
elements.2211.03019_d73ed3b2711d8a91104fcea4ae90f: , we examine localization improvements across multiple samples, specifically where sounding objects exhibit a high flow magnitude through movement
elements.2211.03019_9e5cb67fc6e323151e46afdf6e044: For example, in the first column, LVS
elements.2211.03019_6a9f40d8fd1699cb62920776a66dd: localizes only a small portion of the sounding vehicle, while our method entirely localizes the vehicle, where a significant magnitude of flow is exhibited
elements.2211.03019_0fd7787bfddadd8cefb9982ff19dc: In the fifth column, our method more accurately localizes to the two crowds in the stadium, both of which are sound sources exhibiting movement
elements.2211.03019_45ad49c02e387c944eb929ff8a4fd: However, it is also important to investigate samples where little optical flow is present
elements.2211.03019_7f732876bdc335c3d327c978bb43f: It is possible that a frame in a video exhibits little movement, for example, a stationary car or person emitting noise
elements.2211.03019_0c25f53b5e384a569491c73f354c3: In these cases, there is no meaningful optical flow to localize towards
elements.2211.03019_7df289927353bc7f0c42934ac54f1: , we see that even in the absence of significant optical flow, our method still localizes on par or better compared to LVS
elements.2211.03019_72e46950e5f5119486c79cda3f426: This reinforces that optical flow is used as an
elements.2211.03019_ec25f0fd4fb36e12b8c75d057d55f: prior, where areas of high movement when present,
elements.2211.03019_dfe4132baf53502431b8353efa20b: be used to localize better, but is not required
elements.2211.03019_91bf4b488ea1ac07c0602283e2abd: In the following section, we further investigate the exact effects of introducing priors like optical flow into the self-supervised framework.
elements.2211.03019_e3693d8fce33e2f3f533eb689a251: In this section, we explore the implications of our design choices with multiple ablation studies
elements.2211.03019_91eabd5e03a5deb8cb395b3c8d2d2: , we explore the need for informative priors to train a self-supervised audio localization network
elements.2211.03019_5cb1a763ce2902975e8037106338e: We introduce optical flow as one of these priors, in addition to pretraining the vision network on ImageNet to provide an object-centric prior
elements.2211.03019_8a537d97d70e8f2aeb14b989029f8: , we study the individual effects of each of these design choices, namely adding the flow attention mechanism, ImageNet weights for the vision encoder, and freezing the vision encoder during training
elements.2211.03019_2c27544a1c755ce7cdfd27a5fcd38: When training the model without any priors (model 4.a), we see that performance suffers as there is little meaningful information for the self-supervised objective
elements.2211.03019_78f0dac932498b91dd68d3388d26c: However, when simply adding the optical flow attention previously described (model 4.d), we see a large performance improvement as the network can now use optical flow to better localize, as moving objects are often the ones exhibiting sound
elements.2211.03019_bd9cae837a4c177d4bdb61b709944: Similarly, when using ImageNet pretrained weights (Table 4.b), we see a significant performance improvement as the model now has an object-centric prior, where salient objects in an image are often exhibiting sound
elements.2211.03019_7e247b7b8d49ee1a9b6d3705f807b: When combining both priors (model 4.e), we see even further performance improvements, which show the importance of incorporating
elements.2211.03019_fd1fc6b2247dd072f700c8a341b01: informative priors for the self-supervised sound localization objective.
elements.2211.03019_2aff387f398ba6fa60016df1544a0: We further explore the effects of freezing the vision encoder during training
elements.2211.03019_c400881b15ed010506c5af496d094: As previously mentioned, a network pretrained on a classification task such as ImageNet will often have high activations around salient objects (an object-centric prior)
elements.2211.03019_5349f31b8ee3df42bbe43b8dc185f: When training in a self-supervised setting, the network may divert from its original weights and instead have a less object-centric focus, which may be suboptimal for sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_ecae127901cb05ce59afe8880c86b: When freezing the network in the non-flow setting (model 4.c), we see performance slightly decrease compared to the unfrozen counterpart (model 4.b)
elements.2211.03019_4653692fe12f21f06623cb896dd27: However, when freezing the network in the optical flow setting (model 4.f), we see a slight improvement over the flow setting with an unfrozen vision encoder (model 4.e)
elements.2211.03019_a43dd6e0b4cdac86fd21b6a9a2e30: We infer that enforcing the vision encoder to keep its object-centric characteristics while the flow encoder can reason and attend towards other parts of the image produces a more informative representation, improving localization performance
elements.2211.03019_26571895ef0c00beb6be6c1c1e897: Finally, we explore variations of the optical flow encoder to better understand how the optical flow information is being used
elements.2211.03019_b9370a18464f341de14ea746251cb: We replace the learnable ResNet18 encoder with a single max pooling layer to see if the simple presence of movement is still informative for localizing sounds
elements.2211.03019_f3e93f855f249cf9c59d0b13f2676: , when using a simple max pooling layer (model 5.a), we still notice a significant performance improvement over the network without optical flow (models 4.a-c)
elements.2211.03019_aa78c0ddd2e3917cf544f225014d4: However, we see a further improvement over the max pooling layer when using a learnable encoder, like a ResNet18 network
elements.2211.03019_e69722fcdcdba4ec56bcf0e94d73f: While the max pooling layer only captures the presence of movement at a particular location, a learnable encoder allows deeper reasoning of the flow information
elements.2211.03019_54cd6445980788d1acdeb1816b2e8: For example, the eighth column in Figure
elements.2211.03019_8c51d9439fdcf62eca2e33fbf628a: shows an optical flow field where the sounding object (tractor) is not moving but rather the environment around it is
elements.2211.03019_ad255e3e69fa2f6e58e5db799bb33: In this case, with the max pooling encoder, the network is biased away from the sounding object, whereas a learnable encoder can better reason about the flow in the given frame, improving overall localization performance.
elements.2211.03019_1b9c9409f8e83e1250e7761ea6991: In this work, we introduce a novel self-supervised sound source localization method that uses optical flow to aid in the localization of a sounding object in a frame of a video
elements.2211.03019_9f0aa70953fa3c31e4060e70ed1fe: In a video, moving objects are often the ones making the sound
elements.2211.03019_5d3ccc30d7eb260feda29f2b2771b: We take advantage of this observation by using optical flow as a prior for the self-supervised learning setting
elements.2211.03019_f674ad8f72a57bf9debbd7ee60387: We formulate the self-supervised objective and describe the cross-attention mechanism of optical flow over the corresponding video frame
elements.2211.03019_696af79184315e7c46ea73ab37071: We evaluate our approach on standardized datasets and compare against prior works and show state-of-the-art results across all experiments and evaluations
elements.2211.03019_5092539f7f892014fe8b4c08f5220: Further, we conduct extensive ablation studies to show the necessity and effect of including informative priors like optical flow, into the self-supervised sound localization objective to improve performance
elements.2211.03019_c37340f86d9e4a56984416c858605: While we explore optical flow in this work, there are other priors that may be explored to improve sound source localization further
elements.2211.03019_66b4684e84f1ec2fb8e5046760149: For example, pretraining the audio encoder can likely provide a better understanding of the
elements.2211.03019_c87f442002f830251105d2ab4fb81: of the sound being emitted, which can then be used to help localize toward that specific object
elements.2211.03019_e1d9a1cb2b0f5eb8f0e93b9196067: Further, improving the optical flow generation, for example, using flow estimation methods or aggregating flow across multiple frames, can potentially improve the optical flow signal to ultimately improve overall localization performance
elements.2211.03019_deb0a2488e539394729d46ca67861: We leave exploration of these hypotheses for future work.
elements.2211.03019_e29e12bb0017add24234e235e1da8: This work was supported by the Center for Identification Technology Research (CITeR) and the National Science Foundation (NSF) under grant
elements.2211.03019_3cd1b6bf8c212dc5af56b7df568e8: As mentioned in the main paper, we train our method on the VGG Sound
elements.2211.03019_dbfcd934d08fbc60abf52e62426fc: Both of these datasets are originally aggregated from online video streaming services, YouTube and Flickr, respectively
elements.2211.03019_d27d7e2b276019fa3323dc88d2cde: The authors of both datasets release only video IDs hosted on the platform, meaning that users of these datasets need to individually download and preprocess videos
elements.2211.03019_a0f4348286d989d11ca390d738bdf: A portion of these videos have become unrecoverable, as they have either been removed or blocked on the platform
elements.2211.03019_cf01d7e61588c8cd78877e7dbefec: To construct the training sets of both datasets, we download a random subset of videos in each dataset until enough available videos are collected to construct the 10k and 144k training sets
elements.2211.03019_a3e57bba25b46785c42c0003bfa6e: We then preprocess the videos, extract audio, and construct optical flow maps as described in the main paper
elements.2211.03019_0d62220486b11f4aac45bc26cfcc4: testing set, 5,158 YouTube IDs are provided as the official testing set
elements.2211.03019_34c1817c0ba2db1f62fabe717e5e3: At the time of dataset construction, 488 videos are unrecoverable, resulting in a testing set of 4,670 samples
elements.2211.03019_2e4c9c51a9da53d8517314d64e966: We use these available samples as the VGG Sound Source testing set to construct image-flow-audio pairs for evaluating our method
elements.2211.03019_05d4b073eb91d1b7220d32e24d393: For the Flickr SoundNet test set,
elements.2211.03019_bfa91e542e29b1a710391d4ee9a9b: provides 250 preprocessed image-audio testing pairs that are directly available from the author's official project page
elements.2211.03019_b36fcad36662feef1b1c45ce93fc9: does not provide the original videos of these 250 testing samples, which are required for constructing optical flow fields
elements.2211.03019_723a6555be3998ab6d9887e59aeca: We recover these original videos from the Flickr platform, find the corresponding video frame that the original test sample of that video belongs to, and construct an optical flow field using the subsequent frame
elements.2211.03019_8ef31b2a1792f0480be94202533dc: In this process, we are able to recover 178 videos, making our Flickr SoundNet consist of 178 image-flow-audio samples.
elements.2211.03019_421bfddc8fd7731199469193e483b: The Flickr SoundNet test set, created by
elements.2211.03019_f369c3bbd65571fd0ea8679af3bae: , contains 250 annotated samples randomly selected out of 2,786 total annotated samples.
elements.2211.03019_935d0a4488481a17ebb59ccdfbdd2: originally used these annotated samples to explore supervised and semi-supervised learning methods for visual sound source localization
elements.2211.03019_abd7ad38a6339496bf35ff94ffe85: With the current research landscape of self-supervised sound source localization, the 250 testing samples are used for evaluation and the remaining annotated samples provided by
elements.2211.03019_b03663f935db6bc069ae8c30d2c22: Since our method optimizes a self-supervised objective with no explicit annotations for training, one such alternative is to use these remaining annotated samples for expanding the Flickr SoundNet test set, as they are otherwise unused
elements.2211.03019_1866fc84d0c955e726b5030b9e79f: We collect and preprocess these remaining annotated samples to construct a novel Flickr SoundNet test set consisting of 1,769 samples
elements.2211.03019_682dd24b458299cec2eb5f08eeafa: , we show results on the expanded Flickr SoundNet test set in a similar fashion to the quantitative results in the main paper on the official Flickr SoundNet test set
elements.2211.03019_258cf6b079353001123171faf3b90: Specifically, we compare our method against LVS
elements.2211.03019_dc220cb57bdef412d0212a0da2097: , where models are trained on both subsets of the Flickr SoundNet training sets, in addition to VGG Sound 144k
elements.2211.03019_17e6b8786f6f3848588c94cc0645a: As shown, our method significantly outperforms LVS
elements.2211.03019_036e1a684eabccf3ca1b0d76edbd1: in the expanded testing scenario, showing our method is still robust to a much larger-scale testing set that spans more sounding categories than the official test set
elements.2211.03019_e98199863e61b70eb8837854bc34a: In addition, when comparing against testing on the official 250 samples, we see a reduction in performance across all methods, showing that expanding the testing set leads to a more challenging sound source localization scenario
elements.2211.03019_796d027e0d10926fa03fd26140e68: For example, for our method trained on Flickr 144k, we achieve 0.865 cIoU and 0.639 AUC on the official test set, compared to 0.759 cIoU and 0.575 AUC on the expanded testing set we introduce
elements.2211.03019_2edc9a6901b6c4567c952a7ba1bac: We believe this evaluation on 1,769 annotated samples instead of 250 samples offers a more robust and representative testing set, which can be used for future self-supervised visual sound localization works for improved evaluations.
elements.2211.03019_9f47ebef4858a7d74b4e3a1defee9: As mentioned in the main paper, we use ResNet18 feature extractors for the visual, audio, and flow portions of our method
elements.2211.03019_bbba5ec7cd33d03321998a213b1c9: For a given sample, the output features of the visual encoder,
elements.2211.03019_86244c39d4fb1ed85b68fa5d893eb: spatial feature map where each spatial location has a feature vector of
elements.2211.03019_25291ba3ebc1af6da0a3d784531a5: These features, once attended over with the optical flow localization network, are used with the audio representation of the sample to construct
elements.2211.03019_79bba6666f0d0c0a6dda09331fa58: is upscaled to the size of the original image, which represents the visual sound source localization of that image
elements.2211.03019_19170dfd03fde0d89775122d43baa: Furthermore, the attended visual and audio representations are both
elements.2211.03019_6f9de34219d22d00daad9fc16225a: For data augmentations, we randomly crop each image and optical flow map, in addition to a 50
elements.2211.03019_c2cadb5c7080fe92dfc8eb60588a1: chance of applying a horizontal flip to both
elements.2211.03019_8c7e5c9fffefde33bfabe33c7b395: We normalize the images using the standardized ImageNet normalization statistics and the optical flow maps using a mean of 0 and standard deviation of 1.
elements.2211.03019_7c418770256b7d343e988ec5b86da: , we visualize examples comparing our method against LVS
elements.2211.03019_111998d5bbc91aef87437ed3e9bba: on our expanded Flickr SoundNet test set, described in
elements.2211.03019_e9e2ec75c41074a1f84069cba8980: As shown, our method is able to reliably localize towards the visual sound source, both in the presence and absence of meaningful optical flow information
elements.2211.03019_75f63ba091cf06129233c7c3ba9d5: Further, we show that these otherwise unused labeled samples are of high quality and are a useful addition for better evaluating self-supervised visual sound source localization methods
elements.2211.03019_0b769c4aa65c27285185d6397bf9d: These annotated samples, previously reserved for training, are not needed for the self-supervised learning objective.
elements.2211.03019_40b72c190402f8a87d60902528007: , since many of the videos in the dataset are missing, generating perfromance numbers for prior works on the available test videos becomes important to fairly assess the contribution of our work
elements.2211.03019_40d1ebf271a8a0b19ae52933d2d7e: We present a comparison of the performance of
elements.2211.03019_d9a90d11330528cc6e40501795ff5: against our method, since it is the most relevant to our proposed approach
